PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. James Jackson, 1520 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 8, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should jitney drivers be licensed and permitted to operate, or should they be jailed?" answer reads: "They should be permitted to operate. This will give a man a chance to make an honest nickel.  Also, a lot of times you cannot get a taxicab when you need one."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Jackson wearing leather hat and dark corduroy jacket with light colored striped trim, standing in front of vacant lot with telephone poles and buildings in background
